channel.title: I have a problem!
channel.description: I had my server running, and I was playing on my client. My friend wants to join my server and I use Hamachi. He is connected to me with Hamachi that is how we are chatting. He typed in my server ip and it said "Error Connecting to server". How does my friend play my server with Hamachi? PLEASE HELP. Thanks!

item.title: I have a problem!
item.dc:creator: @aaa805 aaa805
item.description:
@aaa805 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:8, topic:517203”][quote author=GodexCAB link=topic=635464.msg4285756#msg4285756 date=1366312418]

Mod lock this. (double post)

Not a double post, just two idiots having a similar title.

I am an idiot?? Please explain why…
[/quote]
Ignore him, he’s just being mean because you don’t know much about RSPS which isn’t a big deal; don’t worry about it.

Ontopic: You get that error when the client can’t connect to the ip that is stated in the client (you may have forgotten to compile?) so either you’ve missed out a step in setting up your Hatatchi (network?) or your going to have to portforward or if you can afford it buy a VPS etc.
You never know though, the server itself might not work properly so download a popular source and client that you know how to set it up and see if that works. I’ve never used Hamatchi so I can’t offer you advice in that respect.[/quote]

I wasn’t referring to him being a idiot for his lack of knowledge, rather for his post title being stupid.

Read full topic

Ignore him, he’s just being mean because you don’t know much about RSPS which isn’t a big deal; don’t worry about it.

Ontopic: You get that error when the client can’t connect to the ip that is stated in the client (you may have forgotten to compile?) so either you’ve missed out a step in setting up your Hatatchi (network?) or your going to have to portforward or if you can afford it buy a VPS etc.
You never know though, the server itself might not work properly so download a popular source and client that you know how to set it up and see if that works. I’ve never used Hamatchi so I can’t offer you advice in that respect.[/quote]

Thank you

Ignore him, he’s just being mean because you don’t know much about RSPS which isn’t a big deal; don’t worry about it.

Ontopic: You get that error when the client can’t connect to the ip that is stated in the client (you may have forgotten to compile?) so either you’ve missed out a step in setting up your Hatatchi (network?) or your going to have to portforward or if you can afford it buy a VPS etc.
You never know though, the server itself might not work properly so download a popular source and client that you know how to set it up and see if that works. I’ve never used Hamatchi so I can’t offer you advice in that respect.

item.title: I have a problem!
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“aaa805, post:2, topic:517203”][quote author=GodexCAB link=topic=635464.msg4285739#msg4285739 date=1366310967]
I had my server running, and I was playing on my client. My friend wants to join my server and I use Hamachi. He is connected to me with Hamachi that is how we are chatting. He typed in my server ip and it said “Error Connecting to server”.
How does my friend play my server with Hamachi? PLEASE HELP.
Thanks!
[/quote]

Firstly, scrap hamachi unless you REALLY need it (protip, you don’t)
Forward the port in your router, and then he should be able to connect
http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/[/quote]

I can not Port Forward.

Read full topic

item.title: I have a problem!
item.dc:creator: @aaa805 aaa805
item.description:
@aaa805 wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:1, topic:517203”]I had my server running, and I was playing on my client. My friend wants to join my server and I use Hamachi. He is connected to me with Hamachi that is how we are chatting. He typed in my server ip and it said “Error Connecting to server”.
How does my friend play my server with Hamachi? PLEASE HELP.
Thanks![/quote]

Firstly, scrap hamachi unless you REALLY need it (protip, you don’t)
Forward the port in your router, and then he should be able to connect
http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/

Read full topic
